content: I've been reading a book about the history of winter festivals around the world, and it's made me want to explore more about the cultural significance of winter in different parts of the world. Speaking of which, I've been thinking about my own morning routine and how it's changed since winter started. I've noticed that I've been hitting the snooze button a lot more often, probably because it's darker outside and I just want to snuggle under the blankets for a bit longer. Do you think that's a common phenomenon, or is it just me?
